comments:
Build ID: Eclipse3.3M6

Steps To Reproduce:
I cannot provide an example because I see this problem with one of our product Properties dialog. This dialog tries to add to its own page set Page_ToolChain instance. This is a result of too loose condition in managedbuilder.ui.plugin.xml for property page element with id="org.eclipse.ui.propertypages.project.ref14". Interpretation of this condition causes CoreException:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: No property tester contributes a property toolEditEnabled to type class com.qnx.tools.ide.mat.internal.core.model.MSession
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.expressions.TypeExtensionManager.getProperty(TypeExtensionManager.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.expressions.TestExpression.evaluate(TestExpression.java:95)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.expressions.CompositeExpression.evaluateAnd(CompositeExpression.java:53)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.expressions.AndExpression.evaluate(AndExpression.java:29)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.dialogs.RegistryPageContributor.failsEnablement(RegistryPageContributor.java:257)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.dialogs.RegistryPageContributor.isApplicableTo(RegistryPageContributor.java:208)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.dialogs.PropertyPageContributorManager.contribute(PropertyPageContributorManager.java:143)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.dialogs.PropertyDialog.createDialogOn(PropertyDialog.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.PropertyDialogAction.createDialog(PropertyDialogAction.java:175)
	at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.PropertyDialogAction.run(PropertyDialogAction.java:154)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.Action.runWithEvent(Action.java:498)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetSelection(ActionContributionItem.java:545)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$2(ActionContributionItem.java:490)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$5.handleEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:402)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:938)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:3673)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:3284)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:2337)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:2301)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.access$4(Workbench.java:2176)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$4.run(Workbench.java:463)
	at org.eclipse.core.databinding.observable.Realm.runWithDefault(Realm.java:289)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:458)
	at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:149)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.application.IDEApplication.start(IDEApplication.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:146)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:106)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:356)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:171)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:476)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:416)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1141)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1116)

which leads to described effect.
I think, the good idea is just to set this condition to the end of <and> block.
 




More information:

You can move "toolEditEnabled" check down and test.
Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce your problem yet.

Problem is fixed.

Now, "toolEditEnabled" check requies IAdaptable type - 
it seems to be wide enougth to cover most of used classes.

In case when class used bu you does not implement IAdaptable,
please either reopen this bug and provide required class name 
(as wide as possible) to be added.

Or simply add yourself one more <propertyTester> section to 
<extension point="org.eclipse.core.expressions.propertyTesters">
in org.eclipse.cdt.ui/plugin.xml.
It could be easily reproduced on breakpoint properties dialog (I was told that there was recently opened PR about that). Your fixing works for me and for this one as well.
*** Bug 179989 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

We have a similar problem in Target Management / RSE, bug 181019.

Right now I have no idea where and how to fix this "toolEditEnabled" issue.
Could you give me a hint where this has actually been fixed in the CDT, such that I could look at it and understand?

Created an attachment (id=63029)
Patched org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.ui/plugin.xml for cdt 4.0.0m6

In fact I cannot reproduce bug 181019 without CDT, so I assume I'm seeing the messages because of this CDT bug only. Looking at the report again, it seems that the fix is in org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.ui/plugin.xml v1.83.

Attached is v1.83 of this plugin.xml - dropping it into CDT 4.0.0m6 managedbuilder.ui instead of the original plugin.xml should serve as a patch for the issue.
*** Bug 181019 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Hm... replacing the plugin.xml in org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.ui_*.jar did not fix the issue for me. But I'm still sure that this is a CDT issue since we nowhere define toolEditEnabled, and it occurs only with the CDT active.

Were any other files except the named plugin.xml touched?

Martin is right - error message is generated by CDT.
In fact, it does not affect other Eclipse components,
but users can be surprized.

Anyway, patch for org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.ui
cannot not fix problem. It would be better to get 
whole CDT from CVS head. If it is not possible, we
need to edit org.eclipse.cdt.ui/plugin.xml file:

find "propertyTesters" line and replace whole
extension with code below:

  <extension
        point="org.eclipse.core.expressions.propertyTesters">
      <propertyTester
           id="org.eclipse.cdt.Tester3"
           class="org.eclipse.cdt.ui.newui.PropertyTester"
           namespace="org.eclipse.cdt.ui"
           properties="toolEditEnabled"
           type="java.lang.Object"/>
      <propertyTester
           id="org.eclipse.cdt.Tester1"
           class="org.eclipse.cdt.ui.newui.PropertyTester"
           namespace="org.eclipse.cdt.ui"
           properties="isSource"
           type="org.eclipse.cdt.core.model.ITranslationUnit"/>
      <propertyTester
           id="org.eclipse.cdt.Tester2"
           class="org.eclipse.cdt.ui.newui.PropertyTester"
           namespace="org.eclipse.cdt.ui"
           properties="isSource"
           type="org.eclipse.core.resources.IFile"/>
  </extension>

Oleg - thanks a lot for your comment. What I don't understand now is -- is it possible to fix this with a simple patch (i.e. replacing a single jarfile in CDT 4.0m6) or is it impossible?

If possible, it would be great to attach a properly patched jarfile on this bug such that others (who will undoubtedly fall into this issue) are not confused.

Or probably even re-release CDT 4.0m6 for Europa? What about doing CDT 4.0m6a or, better yet, 4.0m6eh? Doug?

>If possible, it would be great to attach a properly patched 
> jarfile on this bug such that others (who will undoubtedly 
>fall into this issue) are not confused.

jar will be attached soon.

>Or probably even re-release CDT 4.0m6 for Europa? What about doing CDT 4.0m6a
>or, better yet, 4.0m6eh? Doug?

I think this problem is not a reason for re-release.
I repeat, this err message does not affect anything.

Created an attachment (id=63035)
Patched file org.eclipse.cdt.ui/plugin.xml

Unfortunately, I cannot attach patched jar (org.eclipse.cdt.ui_4.0.0.200703302000.jar)
because it's too big (bugZilla refuses to
accept it as attach).

Cool, thanks a lot - this is very helpful.

Would it be possible to upload a patched org.eclipse.cdt.ui to the download server (cdt.eclipse.org or download.eclipse.org) and put a hyperlink in here?

Note that this bug manifests as a BLOCKER in the following situation:

Help > Software Updates > Manage Configuration
  - Select a feature
  - Click on the "Properties" link on the right hand side

The Properties dialog has a page labeled "C/C++ ToolChain edit"
Closing the Properties dialog is no longer possible. An error message 
   "An error has occurred. Check the Error Log for details"
is shown for every action. User is stuck completely and can only kill Eclipse.

This problem is NOT fixed by the attached patch to cdt.ui/plugin.xml.

Unfortunately I cannot easily check this with CDT HEAD.
Reopening the bug for further investigation.
Setting severity CRITICAL since it hangs all of Eclipse.
Oleg, could you take a look?

Please tell me what I do wrong...
1. Unpacking Eclipse M6 & CDT M6.
2. Running Eclipse, reproducing problem.
3. Killing Eclipse after problem reproduction.
4. Going to plugins directory.
5. Copying here plugin.xml from attachment.
6. executing: "zip -u org.eclipse.cdt.ui_4.0.0.200703302000.jar plugin.xml"
7. checking that plugin.xml is really updated in jar file.
8. Running Eclipse, reproducing problem.
9. No problem found.

Unfortunately I still cannot eiter attach modified jar to BugZilla 
(it's too big), or to upload it to Eclipse.org (no privileges).

I hope plugin.xml can help itself. Otherwize, I can send jar by
e-mail upon request.

Hm... I tried updating plugin.xml in the cdt.ui JAR with WinZIP.
Perhaps something went wrong in there.

Feel free to E-Mail me the updated jar directly, I can upload it to the DSDP space on download.eclipse.org and post a link in this bug. My E-Mail address is just the bugzilla ID (author of this comment).

Thanks to Oleg Krasilnikov, we've been able to come with a complete working patch for the issue. Get the following archive:

http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/dsdp/tm/div/patch180286_cdt_propertytester.zip

extract into your Eclipse installation, overriding the
   org.eclipse.cdt.ui_*.jar
   org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.ui_*.jar
plugins. Then, restart Eclipse with the -clean option:
   eclipse -clean

Oleg feel free to attach the patches for plugin.xml that finally worked, and mark the issue fixed.

Created an attachment (id=64138)
Patched plugin.xml for org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.ui

Note that both these files are intended for M6.
They do not fit to latest CDT version from HEAD.
Closing bug.
*** Bug 183592 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 183086 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Again, for all who are bitten by this -- a patch for CDT 4.0M6 is available at
http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/dsdp/tm/div/patch180286_cdt_propertytester.zip

See comment #18 for instructions. Since two duplicates have been filed in the meantime, and the effect of this can be a complete hang at least for the update manager, I was wondering whether the CDT leads might want to consider making this issue more public and/or providing the patch in a more official form?

Just replacing the bits on the Europa update site might be helpful already and is a very small effort.

(In reply to comment #23)
I agree we should find a way to propagate the fix for this one.
Any europa install will have this annoying issue, which forces to kill the workbench.
I had the case while editing the properties of an Exception displayed in the console: had to kill the java process in the middle of a debug. grr...
*** Bug 184194 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 182091 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
